subject: p16360107
History: History of HIV and new shortness of breath.
Findings: Again seen are bilateral loculated pleural effusions, consistent with prior CT in. Median sternotomy wires and surgical clips are noted. Ill-defined opacities at the right base are unchanged from multiple priors and most likely represent atelectasis. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is within normal limits.
Impression: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality. Chronic loculated pleural effusions and right basilar atelectasis, unchanged.
